title: Who may make an anatomical gift before donor's death
context: [ยง327-4] Who may make an anatomical gift before donor&rsquo;s death. Subject to section 327-8, an anatomical gift of a donor&rsquo;s body or body part may be made during the life of the donor for transplantation, therapy, research, or education in the manner provided in section 327-5 by: (1) The donor, if the donor is at least eighteen years of age or is under eighteen years of age and is: (A) An emancipated minor, as deemed pursuant to section 577-25; or (B) Authorized under a state law to apply for a driver&rsquo;s license under part VI of chapter 286; (2) An agent of the donor, unless the power of attorney for health care or other record prohibits the agent from making an anatomical gift; (3) A parent of the donor, if the donor is under eighteen years of age and not emancipated; or (4) The donor&rsquo;s guardian.
